conclusion: Metal rod MN is placed on two parallel rails separated by 15 cm (0.15 m). Rails are inclined at 30° to the horizontal. Rod mass is m = 17 g = 0.017 kg. Rod resistance R₁ = 4 Ω. Rheostat R₂ is in series with the rod. Magnetic field B = 0.6 T pointing vertically upward. Power source E = 10 V with internal resistance r = 1 Ω. Rod remains stationary on the smooth rails. g = 10 m/s².

premise: Rod remains stationary on the smooth rails.
conclusion: When the rod is stationary on the inclined rails, two forces balance: the component of gravitational force parallel to the rails and the Ampere force.

premise: The component of gravitational force parallel to the rails: mg·sin(30°).
Ampere force F_A = BIL and F_A = mg·sin(30°).
Using Ohm's law for the complete circuit: E = I(R₁ + R₂ + r).
Substituting I = 0.944... A into the equation 10 V = I(5 Ω + R₂).
F_A = 0.085 N with one significant figure.
conclusion: With one significant figure, F_A = 0.09 N.

premise: Calculated values: F_A = 0.09 N and R₂ = 6 Ω.
conclusion: The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the metal rod is 0.09 N. The resistance value of R₂ is 6 Ω.
